About Innlevering 3 Maven Webapp

Description

A webapplication that checks if a number is a prime number or not. It lets a user enter a input and based on a calculation made in PrimeCheck, the user receives a result on a another page whether the input is a prime number or not. If input is invalid, the user is notified by a errormessage.

To create a Maven project I used archetype-webapp.The solution is pretty simple. It contains 3 classes. The frontpage is a index.jsp file with a inputfield and a button. To retrieve the startpage I created a servlet class called StartServlet that uses a doGet method. I chose to use @WebServlet annotation instead of entering servlet information in web.xml file.

PrimeCheck uses a third party library from Apache Commons to perform the calculation. By using Primes.isPrime() method, I'm able to check if the number is prime or not.

PrimeNumberServlet contatins a doGet method that redirects user to the frontpage and a doPost method that accepts input from the user and displays it on another page. Since this class is a servlet I used a @WebServlet annotation here too. PrimeNumberServlet containts also a method that checks if the number is less than or equal to zero , if yes , the user is advised to enter a positive number. I haven't put so much effort in designing the application since it wasn't a requirement. The solution is quite simple but it's working properly.

Deployment on Tomcat 8

No special requirements. If you want to deploy the application to Tomcat, you can upload Innlevering3.war file on this page http://localhost:8080/manager/html.

JavaDoc

To generate Javadoc it was necessary to add javadoc plugin to pom.xml and enter the command "mvn site" in terminal. Javadocs can be found in Project Reports/JavaDocs.

pom.xml

Information about dependencies and plugins that were used in the project are saved in pom.xml file.

Tests

PrimeCheckTest contains 4 tests: a test that checks if the input is valid or not, a test that checks if input is an integer, a test that checks if a method called getNum returns an integer and a test that checks if correct answer has been sent to the client.

Log4j

Application logs all user requests in the requests.log file. All exceptions are logged in errors.log. Log4j configuration can be found in log4j2.xml file. Requests and errors are also logged in the console.

Plugins

Extra plugins: JavaDoc plugin generates javadoc from the comments in the code. SureFire plugin generates the test classes from the application.The generated information can be found in Project Reports/Surefire Report.
